projects.demoDescription: We have built a Q&A chatbot that answers questions based on the Langfuse Docs. Interact with it to see traces in Langfuse.
projects.organizationsDescription: Organizations help you manage access to projects. Each organization can have multiple projects and team members with different roles.
projects.createOrgToGetStarted: Create an organization to get started. Alternatively, ask your organization admin to invite you.
projects.needInviteToGetStarted: You need to get invited to an organization to get started with Langfuse.

prompts.title: Prompts
prompts.manageDescription: Manage and version your prompts in Langfuse. Edit and update them via the UI and SDK. Retrieve the production version via the SDKs. Learn more in the docs.
prompts.lastUsedTooltip: The last time this prompt version was used in a generation. See docs for details on how to link generations/traces to prompt versions.
prompts.firstUsedTooltip: The first time this prompt version was used in a generation. See docs for details on how to link generations/traces to prompt versions.

widgets.title: Widgets
widgets.manageDescription: Manage and create widgets for your dashboard.

common.requestChartDescription: Your feedback matters! Let the Langfuse team know what additional data or metrics you'd like to see in your dashboard.
common.provideFeedbackDescription: What do you think about Langfuse? What can be improved? Please share it with the community on GitHub to shape the future of Langfuse.
common.deleteCommentConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this comment?

auth.name: Name
auth.contactSupport: Contact support if this error is unexpected.
auth.makeSureCorrectRegion: Make sure you are using the correct cloud data region.
auth.unableToCheckSSO: Unable to check SSO configuration. Please try again.
auth.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters long
auth.anErrorOccurred: An error occurred. Please try again.
auth.refreshPageMessage: If you are experiencing issues signing in, please force refresh this page (CMD + SHIFT + R) or clear your browser cache. We are working on a solution.
auth.inputShouldNotContainURL: Input should not contain a URL
auth.pleaseChooseSecurePassword: Please choose a secure password by combining letters, numbers, and special characters.
auth.oauthAccountNotLinked: Please sign in with the same provider (e.g. Google, GitHub, Azure AD, etc.) that you used to create this account.
auth.byActionAgreeing: By {{action}} you are agreeing to our
auth.confirmDataAccurate: You also confirm that the entered data is accurate.
auth.demoProjectNotAvailableHIPAA: Demo project is not available in the HIPAA data region.
auth.dataRegionsDescription: Langfuse Cloud is available in two data regions:
auth.dataRegionsSeparated: Regions are strictly separated, and no data is shared across regions. Choosing a region close to you can help improve speed and comply with local data residency laws and privacy regulations. Contact us to onboard into a HIPAA compliant region.
auth.dataRegionsAccounts: You can have accounts in both regions and data migrations are available on Team plans.

traces.title: Traces
traces.traceDeleteDescription: Selected trace will be deleted. Traces are removed asynchronously and may continue to be visible for up to 15 minutes.
traces.pageDescription: A trace represents a single function/api invocation. Traces contain observations. See docs to learn more.

observations.title: Observations
observations.pageDescription: Observations record a single function call in your application. See docs to learn more.

scores.title: Scores
scores.pageDescription: A score is an evaluation of a trace or observation. It can be created from user feedback, model-based evaluations, or manual review. See docs to learn more.

settings.title: Settings
settings.transferOwnershipDesc: Transfer this project to another organization where you have the ability to create projects.
settings.deleteProjectDesc: Once you delete a project, there is no going back. Please be certain.
settings.posthogDescription: We have teamed up with PostHog (OSS product analytics) to make Langfuse Events/Metrics available in your Posthog Dashboards.
settings.blobStorageDescription: Configure scheduled exports of your trace data to S3 compatible storages or Azure Blob Storage. Set up a scheduled export to your own storage for data analysis or backup purposes.
settings.slackDescription: Connect a Slack workspace and create channel automations to receive Langfuse alerts natively in Slack.

integrations.blobStorageDescription: Configure scheduled exports of your trace data to AWS S3, S3-compatible storages, or Azure Blob Storage. Set up a hourly, daily, or weekly export to your own storage for data analysis or backup purposes. Use the "Validate" button to test your configuration by uploading a small test file, and the "Run Now" button to trigger an immediate export.
integrations.noAccessMessage: Your current role does not grant you access to these settings, please reach out to your project admin or owner.
integrations.validateTooltip: Test your saved configuration by uploading a small test file to your storage
integrations.runNowTooltip: Trigger an immediate export of all data since the last sync
integrations.runNowConfirm: Are you sure you want to run the blob storage export now? This will export all data since the last sync.
integrations.resetConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset the Blob Storage integration for this project?
integrations.posthogDescription: We have teamed up with PostHog (OSS product analytics) to make Langfuse events/metrics available in your PostHog dashboards. Upon activation, all historical data from your project will be synced. After the initial sync, new data is automatically synced every hour to keep your PostHog dashboards up to date.
integrations.resetPosthogConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset the PostHog integration for this project?
integrations.testSlackIntegrationDesc: Test your Slack integration by sending a message to a channel.
integrations.selectChannelToViewDetails: Select a channel above to view its details and test message delivery.

delete.cannotBeUndone: This action cannot be undone and removes all the data associated with this {entity}.
delete.dashboardDeleteDescription: The dashboard has been deleted successfully
delete.runningEvaluatorDeleteDescription: The running evaluator has been deleted successfully
delete.runningEvaluatorDeletePrompt: This action cannot be undone and removes all logs associated with this running evaluator. Scores produced by this evaluator will not be deleted.
delete.defaultEvaluationModelDeleteDescription: The default evaluation model has been deleted. Any running evaluations relying on the default model will be inactivated. Queued jobs will fail.
delete.defaultEvaluationModelDeletePrompt: Deleting this model might cause running evaluators to fail. Please make sure you have no running evaluators relying on this model.

actionButton.limitReached: You have reached the limit ({current}/{max}) for this resource at your current plan. Upgrade your plan to increase the limit.
actionButton.noAccess: You do not have access to this resource, please ask your admin to grant you access.
actionButton.entitlement: This feature is not available in your current plan.

traces.title: Get Started with LLM Tracing
traces.description: Traces allow you to track every LLM call and other relevant logic in your app/agent. Nested traces in Langfuse help to understand what is happening and identify the root cause of problems.

fullContext.title: Full context capture
fullContext.description: Track the complete execution flow including API calls, context, prompts, parallelism and more

costMonitoring.title: Cost monitoring
costMonitoring.description: Track model usage and costs across your application

basisForEvaluation.title: Basis for evaluation
basisForEvaluation.description: Add evaluation scores to identify issues and track metrics over time

openMultimodal.title: Open and Multi-modal
openMultimodal.description: Langfuse traces can include images, audio, and other modalities. You can fully customize them to fit your needs

sessions.title: Get Started with Sessions
sessions.description: Sessions allow you to group related traces together, such as a conversation or thread. Use sessions to track interactions over time and analyze conversation/thread flows.

groupTraces.title: Group related traces
groupTraces.description: Sessions allow you to group related traces, such as a conversation or thread, for better organization and analysis

trackInteractions.title: Track user interactions
trackInteractions.description: Monitor how users interact with your application over time

analyzeFlows.title: Analyze conversation flows
analyzeFlows.description: Understand the complete flow of multi-turn conversations

sessionMetrics.title: Session-level metrics
sessionMetrics.description: Get aggregated metrics for entire sessions, including costs and token usage

gettingStarted.prefix: To start using sessions, you need to add a

users.title: Get Started with User Tracking
users.description: Correlate costs, evaluations and other LLM Application metrics to specific users. Start tracking users to better understand how they interact with your LLM applications.

trackInteractions.title: Track user interactions
trackInteractions.description: Attribute data in Langfuse to specific users by adding a userId to your traces

analyzeBehavior.title: Analyze user behavior
analyzeBehavior.description: Understand how different users interact with your LLM applications

filterSegments.title: Filter by user segments
filterSegments.description: Compare performance across different user segments to identify patterns

monitorUsage.title: Monitor usage metrics
monitorUsage.description: Track token usage, costs, and other metrics on a per-user basis

gettingStarted.prefix: To start tracking users, you need to add a

datasets.title: Get Started with Datasets
datasets.description: Datasets in Langfuse are collections of inputs (and expected outputs) for your LLM application. You can for example use them to benchmark new releases before deployment to production.

continuousImprovement.title: Continuous improvement
continuousImprovement.description: Create datasets from production edge cases to improve your application

preDeployment.title: Pre-deployment testing
preDeployment.description: Benchmark new releases before deploying to production

structuredTesting.title: Structured testing
structuredTesting.description: Run experiments on collections of inputs and expected outputs

customWorkflows.title: Custom workflows
customWorkflows.description: Build custom workflows around your datasets via the API and SDKs, e.g. for fine-tuning, few-shotting

prompts.title: Get Started with Prompt Management
prompts.description: Langfuse Prompt Management helps you centrally manage, version control, and collaboratively iterate on your prompts. Start using prompt management to improve your LLM application's performance and maintainability.

decoupled.title: Decoupled from code
decoupled.description: Deploy new prompts without application redeployment, making updates faster and easier

editing.title: Edit in UI or programmatically
editing.description: Non-technical users can easily edit prompts in the UI. Developers can optionally update prompts programmatically via the API and SDKs

performance.title: Performance optimized
performance.description: Client-side caching prevents latency or availability issues for your applications

compareMetrics.title: Compare metrics
compareMetrics.description: Track latency, cost, and evaluation metrics across different prompt versions

scores.title: Get Started with Scores
scores.description: Scores allow you to evaluate the quality/safety of your LLM application through user feedback, model-based evaluations, or manual review. Scores can be used programmatically via the API and SDKs to track custom metrics.

collectFeedback.title: Collect user feedback
collectFeedback.description: Gather thumbs up/down feedback from users to identify high and low quality outputs

modelEvaluations.title: Run model-based evaluations
modelEvaluations.description: Use LLMs to automatically evaluate your application's outputs

trackQuality.title: Track quality metrics
trackQuality.description: Monitor quality metrics over time to identify trends and issues

customMetrics.title: Use custom metrics
customMetrics.description: Langfuse's scores are flexible and can be used to track any metric that's associated with an LLM application

evaluators.title: Get Started with LLM-as-a-Judge Evaluations
evaluators.description: Create evaluation templates and evaluators to automatically score your traces with LLM-as-a-judge. Set up custom evaluation criteria and let AI help you measure the quality of your outputs.

automate.title: Automate evaluations
automate.description: Use LLM-as-a-judge to automatically evaluate your traces without manual review

measureQuality.title: Measure quality
measureQuality.description: Create custom evaluation criteria to measure the quality of your LLM outputs

scale.title: Scale efficiently
scale.description: Evaluate thousands of traces automatically with customizable sampling rates

trackPerformance.title: Track performance
trackPerformance.description: Monitor evaluation metrics over time to identify trends and improvements

annotationQueues.title: Get Started with Annotation Queues
annotationQueues.description: Annotation queues help you manage manual annotation/labeling for your LLM projects. Create queues, define annotation metrics, and track progress.

manageWorkflows.title: Manage scoring workflows
manageWorkflows.description: Create and manage annotation queues to streamline your scoring workflows

collaborate.title: Collaborate with annotators
collaborate.description: Invite team members to annotate and evaluate your LLM outputs

trackMetrics.title: Track annotation metrics
trackMetrics.description: Monitor annotation progress and quality metrics across your team

baseline.title: Baseline evaluation efforts
baseline.description: Use annotation data as a baseline to evaluate your other evaluation metrics

export.emailNotification: You will receive an email when the export is ready.

sessions.pageDescription: A session is a collection of related traces, such as a conversation or thread. To begin, add a sessionId to the trace.

datasets.pageDescription: Datasets in Langfuse are a collection of inputs (and expected outputs) of an LLM application. They are used to benchmark new releases before deployment to production. See docs to learn more.
datasets.waitingForRun: Waiting for dataset run to complete...
datasets.compareDescription: Compare your dataset runs side by side

users.pageDescription: Attribute data in Langfuse to a user by adding a userId to your traces. See docs to learn more.
users.userIdTooltip: The unique identifier for the user that was logged in Langfuse. See docs for more details on how to set this up.
users.firstEventTooltip: The earliest trace recorded for this user.
users.lastEventTooltip: The latest trace recorded for this user.
users.totalEventsTooltip: Total number of events for the user, includes traces and observations. See data model for more details.
users.totalTokensTooltip: Total number of tokens used for the user across all generations.
users.totalCostTooltip: Total cost for the user across all generations.

dashboards.manageDescription: Manage and create dashboards for your project.
dashboards.createDescription: Create a new dashboard for your project
dashboards.createdDescription: Your new dashboard has been created successfully
dashboards.name: Dashboard Name
dashboards.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe the purpose of this dashboard. Optional, but very helpful.
dashboards.afterCreateHint: After creating the dashboard, you can add widgets to visualize your data.
dashboards.autoSaved: Your changes have been saved automatically
dashboards.filtersSavedDescription: Dashboard filters have been saved successfully

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.tracesDescription: Traces contain details about LLM applications and can be created using the SDK.
dashboard.scoresNoDataDescription: Scores evaluate LLM quality and can be created manually or using the SDK.
dashboard.selectDashboardToAddWidget: Select dashboard to add widget to
dashboard.name: Name
dashboard.dashboardUpdatedDescription: The dashboard has been updated successfully
dashboard.userConsumptionDescription: Consumption per user is tracked by passing their ids on traces.
dashboard.scoreAnalyticsDescription: Aggregate scores and averages over time
dashboard.selectScoreToViewAnalytics: Select a score to view analytics
dashboard.clonedDescription: The dashboard has been cloned successfully

setup.title: Setup
setup.organizationDescription: Organizations are used to manage your projects and teams.
setup.inviteMembersDescription: Invite members to your organization to collaborate on projects. You can always add more members later.
setup.projectDescription: Projects are used to group traces, datasets, evals and prompts. Multiple environments are best separated via tags within a project.
setup.tracingSetupDescription: Set up tracing to start monitoring your LLM application. You can skip this step and setup tracing later.
setup.helpDescription: Create a new organization. This will be used to manage your projects and teams.
setup.apiKeysDescription: These keys are used to authenticate your API requests. You can create more keys later in the project settings.
setup.createApiKeyDescription: You need to create an API key to start tracing your application.
setup.typeDescription: What would best describe your organization?
setup.sizeDescription: How many people are in your {type}?
setup.forSetupDetails: for details on how to set up Langfuse in your organization.
setup.forMoreDetails: for more details and an end-to-end example.
setup.openaiIntegrationDescription: The integration is a drop-in replacement for the OpenAI Python SDK. By changing the import, Langfuse will capture all LLM calls and send them to Langfuse asynchronously.
setup.useOpenAISDK: Use the OpenAI SDK as you would normally. See the
setup.langchainIntegrationDescription: The integration uses the Langchain callback system to automatically capture detailed traces of your Langchain executions.
setup.haveQuestions: Do you have questions or issues? Check out this
setup.secretKeyDescription: This key can only be viewed once. You can always create new keys in the {scope} settings.

llm.adapterDescription: Schema that is accepted at that provider endpoint.
llm.connectDescriptionPrimary: Connect your LLM services to enable evaluations and playground features. Your provider will charge based on usage.
llm.customModelsDescription: Custom model names accepted by given endpoint.
llm.azureCustomModelsHint: For Azure, the model name should be the same as the deployment name in Azure. For evals, choose a model with function calling capabilities.
llm.bedrockCustomModelsHint: For Bedrock, the model name is the Bedrock Inference Profile ID, e.g. 'eu.anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620-v1:0'
llm.extraHeadersDescription: Optional additional HTTP headers to include with requests towards LLM provider. All header values stored encrypted {where}.
llm.providerNameDescription: Key to identify the connection within Langfuse.
llm.awsAccessKeyIdDescCloud: These should be long-lived credentials for an AWS user with `bedrock:InvokeModel` permission.
llm.awsAccessKeyIdDescSelfHosted: For self-hosted deployments, AWS credentials are optional. When omitted, authentication will use the AWS SDK default credential provider chain.
llm.defaultCredentialChainDesc: When AWS credentials are omitted, the system will automatically check for credentials in this order:
llm.learnMoreAwsCredentials: Learn more about AWS credential providers →
llm.apiKeysStoredDescCloud: Your API keys are stored encrypted on our servers.
llm.apiKeysStoredDescSelfHosted: Your API keys are stored encrypted in your database.
llm.vertexJsonHint: Paste your GCP service account JSON key here. The service account must have `Vertex AI User` role permissions. Example JSON:
llm.azureBaseUrlHint: Please add the base URL in the following format (or compatible API): https://{instanceName}.openai.azure.com/openai/deployments
llm.apiBaseUrlAdvancedHint: Leave blank to use the default base URL for the given LLM adapter.
llm.vertexLocationDescription: Specify the Google Cloud location for Vertex AI. If not specified, the default location will be used (us-central1). Examples: us-central1, europe-west4, asia-northeast1
llm.enableDefaultModelsDescription: Default models for the selected adapter will be available in Langfuse features.

latency.title: Langfuse Latency Dashboard
latency.description: Monitor latency metrics across traces and generations for performance optimization.

usage.title: Langfuse Usage Management
usage.description: Track usage metrics across traces, observations, and scores to manage resource allocation.

p95LatencyByUseCase.name: P95 Latency by Use Case
p95LatencyByUseCase.description: P95 latency metrics segmented by trace name

p95LatencyByObservationLevel.name: P95 Latency by Level (Observations)
p95LatencyByObservationLevel.description: P95 latency metrics for observations segmented by level

totalCosts.name: Total costs
totalCosts.description: Total cost across all use cases

costByEnvironment.name: Cost by Environment
costByEnvironment.description: Total cost broken down by trace.environment

maxLatencyByUserIdTraces.name: Max Latency by User Id (Traces)
maxLatencyByUserIdTraces.description: Maximum latency for the top 50 users by trace userId

avgTTFTByPromptName.name: Avg Time To First Token by Prompt Name (Observations)
avgTTFTByPromptName.description: Average time to first token segmented by prompt name

p95TTFTByModel.name: P 95 Time To First Token by Model
p95TTFTByModel.description: P95 time to first token metrics segmented by model

p95LatencyByModel.name: P 95 Latency by Model
p95LatencyByModel.description: P95 latency metrics for observations segmented by model

avgOutputTokensPerSecondByModel.name: Avg Output Tokens Per Second by Model
avgOutputTokensPerSecondByModel.description: Average output tokens per second segmented by model

p95CostPerTrace.name: P 95 Cost per Trace
p95CostPerTrace.description: 95th percentile of cost for each trace

p95OutputCostPerObservation.name: P 95 Output Cost per Observation
p95OutputCostPerObservation.description: 95th percentile of output cost for each observation (llm call)

p95InputCostPerObservation.name: P 95 Input Cost per Observation
p95InputCostPerObservation.description: 95th percentile of input cost for each observation (llm call)

totalTraceCount.name: Total Trace Count
totalTraceCount.description: Total count of traces across all environments

costByModelName.name: Cost by Model Name
costByModelName.description: Total cost broken down by model name

totalObservationCount.name: Total Observation Count
totalObservationCount.description: Total count of observations across all environments

totalScoreCountNumeric.name: Total Score Count (numeric)
totalScoreCountNumeric.description: Total count of numeric scores across all environments

totalScoreCountCategorical.name: Total Score Count (categorical)
totalScoreCountCategorical.description: Total count of categorical scores across all environments

totalTraceCountOverTime.name: Total Trace Count (over time)
totalTraceCountOverTime.description: Trend of trace count over time

totalObservationCountOverTime.name: Total Observation Count (over time)
totalObservationCountOverTime.description: Trend of observation count over time

totalScoreCountNumericOverTime.name: Total Score Count (numeric)
totalScoreCountNumericOverTime.description: Trend of numeric score count over time

totalScoreCountCategoricalOverTime.name: Total Score Count (categorical)
totalScoreCountCategoricalOverTime.description: Trend of categorical score count over time

totalTraceCountByEnv.name: Total Trace Count (by env)
totalTraceCountByEnv.description: Distribution of trace count across different environments

totalObservationCountByEnv.name: Total Observation Count (by env)
totalObservationCountByEnv.description: Distribution of observation count across different environments
